com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.util

Class FileUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.util.FileUtil

  • public class FileUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for reading and writing files to the external storage.
    Author:
    lizlooney@google.com (Liz Looney)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FileUtil.FileException
      Exception class for reporting back media-related error numbers from ErrorMessages, which the caller can in turn pass to Form.dispatchErrorOccurredEvent if needed.

      • getPictureFile

        public static java.io.File getPictureFile(java.lang.String extension)
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          FileUtil.FileException
        Creates a File representing the complete path for an image file, creating the enclosing directories if needed. This does not actually open the file. Any component that calls this must have android.Manifest.permission#WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE.
        Parameters:
        extension - file extension, such as "png" or "jpg"
        Returns:
        the path to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the enclosing directory cannot be created
        FileUtil.FileException - if external storage is not accessible or not writable with the appropriate ErrorMessages error code.

      • getRecordingFile

        public static java.io.File getRecordingFile(java.lang.String extension)
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            FileUtil.FileException
        Creates a File representing the complete path for a recording, creating the enclosing directories if needed. This does not actually open the file. Any component that calls this must have android.Manifest.permission#WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE.
        Parameters:
        extension - file extension, such as "3gp"
        Returns:
        the path to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the enclosing directory cannot be created
        FileUtil.FileException - if external storage is not accessible or not writable with the appropriate ErrorMessages error code.

      • getDownloadFile

        public static java.io.File getDownloadFile(java.lang.String extension)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           FileUtil.FileException
        Creates a File representing the complete path for a downloaded file, creating the enclosing directories if needed. This does not actually open the file. Any component that calls this must have android.Manifest.permission#WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE.
        Parameters:
        extension - file extension, such as "tmp"
        Returns:
        the path to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the enclosing directory cannot be created
        FileUtil.FileException - if external storage is not accessible or not writable with the appropriate ErrorMessages error code.

      • getFile

        private static java.io.File getFile(java.lang.String category,
                                    java.lang.String extension)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    FileUtil.FileException
        Determines the best directory in which to store a file of the given type and creates the directory if it does not exist, generating a full path.
        Parameters:
        category - a descriptive category, such as DIRECTORY_PICTURES to include in the path
        extension - the extension for the end of the file, not including the period, such as "png"
        Returns:
        the full path to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the directory cannot be created
        FileUtil.FileException

      • getExternalFile

        public static java.io.File getExternalFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                                    throws java.io.IOException,
                                           FileUtil.FileException
        Returns the File for fileName in the external storage directory in preparation for writing the file. fileName may contain sub-directories. Ensures that all subdirectories exist and that fileName does not exist (deleting it if necessary).
        Parameters:
        fileName - The path name of the file relative to the external storage directory
        Returns:
        the File object for creating fileName in the external storage
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we are unable to create necessary parent directories or delete an existing file
        FileUtil.FileException - if the external storage is not writeable.

      • checkExternalStorageWriteable

        public static void checkExternalStorageWriteable()
                                          throws FileUtil.FileException
        Throws:
        FileUtil.FileException
